intro: Saxifraga aizoon lagraveana, commonly known as the Lagrave's saxifrage, is a species of flowering plant in the family Saxifragaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
